channel.title: Un-named game v1 (:
channel.description:
Hey guys, Tim here, I'm currently making a game for my IT class, and I though you guys might be able to some feed-back on it. I've put the files as an attatchment to this topic, so if you want to try it then just download it, if you don't trust it then don't download it, It's really simple guys.
Basically this is a simple console game written in java, I'm not ASKING for help, but a suggestion might be nice.
So from the title above you can tell it doesn't have a name, what would you call it? and theres not an actually objective in the game yet (well there is but its lame >.>), what should you achieve, or should it be a that goes for ever? I'm sorta confused about it haha.
Well here is a list of commands: [code] help help tele *location* current location mine -only works at mining area- chop -only works at woodcutting area- fish -only works at fishing area- sell 'amount' 'resource' -only works at shopping area- prices stats save load quit [/code]
What other things should be in the shop that would make it a little interesting :S I was going to add item ranks, like you have a net for level 1, then a rod for level 2? But I'm not sure :S
The only reason I put this up here was for some feed-back haha.
- Tim (:

item.title: Un-named game v1 (:
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

True aoe > Mw2, but I still think you can’t compare between genres. However if that’s how you feel about it well we are all entitled to our opinions.

Read full topic

item.title: Un-named game v1 (:
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:21, topic:381018”][quote author=Graham link=topic=476833.msg3497272#msg3497272 date=1297440781]

How are you guys comparing between AOE and MW? They’re two different genres…

They’re both computer games…
[/quote]
Duh… you’re comparing between a strategy game and a first person shooter, though.
Try Half-Life and MW2, or Aoe and some other new shitty strategy game they came up with.[/quote]

They were just examples but I do still think it is valid to compare across genres. In my opinion AOE 2 has very good gameplay and MW2 had very crap gameplay - even though the graphics in MW2 are obviously a lot more advanced, I’d still prefer to play AOE2 because I’m not some little kid that thinks graphics is everything.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Graham:

Agreed with the point about graphics… I still love to play games like Age of Empires II because they have good gameplay whereas I played my brother’s copy of Modern Warfare 2 for a few hours and just didn’t enjoy it at all.

Long live Age of Empires II

item.title: Un-named game v1 (:
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

eyeownyew:

Btw, you should encrypt the savegame file; otherwise people (me) can edit it.

That’d be useless though: for the program itself to work with it it has to be decrypted somehow, you can find out how the decryption/encryption procedure works (and the key, if any, will be in the program’s source code) and still edit it…

[quote=“LilXCj, post:15, topic:381018”][quote author=John459 link=topic=476833.msg3488597#msg3488597 date=1296785515]
How is this a game?
[/quote]

Just because it doesn’t have amazing graphics or amazing gameplay does not mean it is not a game.[/quote]

Agreed with the point about graphics… I still love to play games like Age of Empires II because they have good gameplay whereas I played my brother’s copy of Modern Warfare 2 for a few hours and just didn’t enjoy it at all.

Read full topic

And i released it for some feed back, thats all. ._.

item.title: Un-named game v1 (:
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

It’s actually this.

fout = new FileOutputStream ("savegame.sav");
new PrintStream(fout).println ("<player>");
new PrintStream(fout).println (" <dollars>" + dollars + "</dollars>");
new PrintStream(fout).println (" <wood>" + wood + "</wood>");
new PrintStream(fout).println (" <fish>" + fish + "</fish>");
new PrintStream(fout).println (" <ore>" + ore + "</ore>");
new PrintStream(fout).println ("</player>");

but you see, I couldn’t find a way to load/save with a text document, so I just used an XML Parser, I mean It’s not like I’m making a multi-million dollar game, It’s just something for IT haha. It doesn’t need to be encrypted because I don’t get extra marks (: Thanks for the feed-back guys, very muchly greatful xD ! But how would you make it encrypted, like what method would you have to do? (:

Edit: I copy and pasted most the load, not much of the save because that was just writing a file :S everything else I made myself, and I’m pretty proud of it, It’s good for me haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Un-named game v1 (:
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:

I don’t know if I’m being stupid or not, but couldn’t he just use a BufferedWriter/Reader?

item.title: Un-named game v1 (:
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Your loadGame code looks very familiar I’m guessing you didn’t write that yourself.

Also:

            FileOutputStream fileoutputstream = new FileOutputStream("savegame.sav");
            (new PrintStream(fileoutputstream)).println("<player>");
            (new PrintStream(fileoutputstream)).println((new StringBuilder()).append(" <dollars>").append(dollars).append("</dollars>").toString());
            (new PrintStream(fileoutputstream)).println((new StringBuilder()).append(" <wood>").append(wood).append("</wood>").toString());
            (new PrintStream(fileoutputstream)).println((new StringBuilder()).append(" <fish>").append(fish).append("</fish>").toString());
            (new PrintStream(fileoutputstream)).println((new StringBuilder()).append(" <ore>").append(ore).append("</ore>").toString());
            (new PrintStream(fileoutputstream)).println("</player>");

New PrintStream every time?

Read full topic

TimmahPwnz:

Should I use your method, or should I try the ‘if exists / if !exists’ to determine weather there’ve saved? Maybe not start with a save game, :S

That would work. Just make it so that the .sav file doesn’t exist until someone types save.

Add a new variable in the .sav file, called or something. Set it to 1 if someone saves Load it if it’s above 0.

item.title: Un-named game v1 (:
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

Hey guys, Tim here, I’m currently making a game for my IT class, and I though you guys might be able to some feed-back on it.
I’ve put the files as an attatchment to this topic, so if you want to try it then just download it, if you don’t trust it then don’t download it, It’s really simple guys.

Basically this is a simple console game written in java, I’m not ASKING for help, but a suggestion might be nice.

So from the title above you can tell it doesn’t have a name, what would you call it? and theres not an actually objective in the game yet (well there is but its lame >.>), what should you achieve, or should it be a that goes for ever? I’m sorta confused about it haha.

Well here is a list of commands:

help
help
tele *location*
current location
mine -only works at mining area-
chop -only works at woodcutting area-
fish -only works at fishing area-
sell 'amount' 'resource' -only works at shopping area-
prices
stats				
save
load
quit

What other things should be in the shop that would make it a little interesting :S
I was going to add item ranks, like you have a net for level 1, then a rod for level 2? But I’m not sure :S

The only reason I put this up here was for some feed-back haha.
